title: Can you publish a book with only 20 pages? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, even shorter books were published in the past. Most are not called a “book”, though, but “booklet” or even “pamphlet”. The major risk for short books is that they can get negative reviews, only due to their length. Not many people look at the page count, before ordering a book. If books in your category are usually much longer, you risk people complaining about the length of the booklet they bought from you. But if you want to try and publish a book with only twenty pages, you could read how this can be done here: Thomas P. Buehner's answer to Is there a minimum number of pages needed to be called a book or can a book be written with just 5 pages?

Speaking from experience, I have once published a 35 pages book which people call a “Chapbook”. But I wasn’t actually satisfied with the length when it was printed, it seemed so short and small. So I just sat there asking myself this “If I was a reader, would I really consider buying a book this thin?” and the answer came to no surprise.. NO! Then I unpublished it, took my full time and worked on what I would call a real book. It’s a 110 pages book, which I’m 100% satisfied with. What I’m saying here is that you should put yourself in a readers’ shoes, think about how it would look and do not rush into making something you may regret later. By the way, I’m talking about certain genres. If it’s a poetry collection or a novel then that’s what you should consider, yet if it’s a children book then I have no idea how it works. Remember that the main goal is to be happy and proud of writing something out, and a book is really a thing. Hope I could be helpful, and best of luck!

Yes. Many children’s books are 20 pages (or even shorter). This is especially true for books aimed at young children. One of the most successful book series by Penguin was their Ladybird series of children’s books, many of them around 20 pages. Poetry is often published in a format called a chapbook, which contains 20 to 30 pages.

There is no yes or no to a question when it comes to writing. Your content will decide what you can do for a book and what you cannot. Your imagination and sensibility as an author will decide what your book is meant for. However, some standard industry guidelines are necessary to be understood. We at Exceller books always advise authors to write at least 50 pages to give the book a publishable size and thickness because the feel (along with the content) is equally important. Absolutely! You could even do a 1-page book if your heart desires. If you are looking to do a paperback book via Amazon’s self-publishing, their minimum page count for print shows as 24 pages at the time of this answer. Of course, you can always go to a local printer and handle it there.
Yes you can. But why do you want to publish such a small book? What kind of book is this?
